data.title: Get lost in the world of art.
data.subtitle: A book and video course that teaches you how to design your own stuff from scratch.

quote.text: This method of designing stuff is genius. I wish I had known this method a lot sooner.
quote.author: Some woman

data.subtitle: “Some artwork you might know” is a book and video course that teaches you a simple method to designing stuff that anyone can learn.
text: Before I learned how to design stuff myself, I always imagined that they were drawn by hand using the pen tool, some sort of fancy graphics tablet, and hours and hours spent manually fine-tuning bezier curves.
But it turns out this isn't how great stuff designers work at all.
In “Some artwok you might know”, you'll learn the systems experts use to create pixel perfect stuff, without relying on a steady hand.
list: Using boolean operations to combine basic shapes into complex stuff
How to adapt stuff to different sizes
Translating stuff from an outline style to a solid style
Identifying the characteristics that make an stuff set cohesive
Figma features and keyboard shortcuts to speed up your workflow
data.conclusion: By the end of the book, you'll have all the confidence you need to dig in and start creating beautiful stuff that can hold their own against any of the stuff you can find online.

link.text: Get two free chapters straight to your inbox →

data.subtitle: Get a look at all of the content covered in the book. Everything you need to know is inside.
text: “Someartwork you might know” is comprised of 240 tightly edited, highly visual pages designed to teach you everything you need to know about icon design with no unnecessary filler.

data.quote: I didn't know a thing about stuff design until I read this book. Now I can create any stuff I need in no time. Great resource!

data.subtitle: Over an hour of high quality, step-by-step video content to sharpen your stuff design workflow.
text: Learn how to design your very first stuffs in a series of screencasts that will teach you everything you need to know to go from beginner to pro in just over an hour.

step.title: Getting started with Figma
step.text: Get familiar with the Figma UI, the different tools it offers, and the most important features.

step.title: Setting up your artboard
step.text: Learn how to create a new artboard and configure your grid and rulers for designing stuff.

step.title: Designing your first stuff
step.text: Using basic shapes and boolean operations, learn how to design your own stuff from scratch.

step.title: Advanced design techniques
step.text: Learn the techniques you need to know to adapt your original stuff to a modern duotone style.

data.subtitle: Tools and resources you can use to get started even faster and progress even further.
text: Design assets, icon teardowns, and a community of fellow icon designers where you can ask questions, get feedback, and accelerate your learning.

list.title: Figma stuff templates
list.text: Pefectly structured templates for quickly designing new stuff at dozens of common sizes.

list.title: Weekly stuff teardowns
list.text: Weekly videos where we dissect and recreate beautiful stuff we find on the web.

list.title: Community of icon designers
list.text: A private Software server where you can get help and give feedback on each others' work.

data.title: Get the free sample chapters
data.subtitle: Get two free chapters straight to your inbox →
text: Enter your email address and I'll send you a sample from the book containing two of my favorite chapters.

data.subtitle: Pick your package
text: “Some artwork you might know” is available in two different packages so you can pick the one that's right for you

text: I worked with a small group of early access customers to make sure all of the content in the book was exactly what they needed. Hears what they had to say about the finished product.

list.author: Lorem Doe

text: Hey there, I'm the author behind 'Some artwork you might know'
I've been designing icons professionally for over a decade and have worked with dozens of the biggest brands to create custom sets for their products.
I'm an accomplished conference speaker, and have been teaching icon design workshops every month for the last three years.
I've worked with designers of all skill levels and honed my way of teaching to really click for anyone who has the itch to start designing their own icons
